{"step_by_step_thinking": "Eisenmenger syndrome is a condition that affects the heart and lungs. It is a type of pulmonary heart disease. The signs of impending Eisenmenger syndrome include increased flow murmur across the tricuspid and pulmonary valve, loud P2, and Graham steel murmur. These are all signs of increased pressure and blood flow in the pulmonary arteries. However, Single S2 is not a sign of impending Eisenmenger syndrome. Single S2 is usually associated with conditions where the aortic and pulmonic valves close simultaneously, which is not characteristic of Eisenmenger syndrome.", "answer_choice": "B"}
